text: The apache manual pages include type maps for content-negotiated pages.  But the type maps are installed as ".html" not ".var", so the default setup is screwed!
creator: nick@webthing.com

text:
The default setup for the manual typemaps assigns the type-map handler to 
the .html extension, so I don't see a problem...
creator: nd@perlig.de

text:
I should add after reading your google URL that the guy there doesn't seem to 
install a vanilla apache. So it would be an alien distribution problem.

(We've changed the default setup in 2.0.47 or so, but some maintainers don't 
seem to get it ...)

creator: nick@webthing.com
text: It's an upgrade bug, affecting anyone moving from an older version:(1) Install 2.0.46.  That'll create a working httpd.conf(2) Install 2.0.48 to the same path.  Now it's broken!

creator: slive@apache.org
text:
It was, perhaps, a mistake to make this change.  But it is done, and
it can't be undone without causing the exact same problem in reverse.

So people will just need to live with modifying their httpd.conf if they
want to see the manual.  It is an irritation, but not a major breakage.

Perhaps we should have a note in the "upgrading" documentation telling
people to look through httpd.conf-dist for changes.
